introduction: The Solid State Physics Virtual Labs are designed to provide students and educators with an interactive and immersive platform to explore foundational concepts in condensed matter physics through simulated experimentation. This lab aims to bridge the gap between theoretical knowledge and practical understanding by offering high-fidelity virtual models of real-world experiments that are central to solid state physics. By simulating essential experiments such as the Hall effect, and four-probe resistivity measurements, this virtual laboratory enhances conceptual clarity and fosters deeper engagement with material properties, electronic behavior, and crystalline structures

experiments.name: Hall effect experiment - Determination of charge carrier density

UG: B.Sc. Physics, B.Tech./B.E. (EEE, ECE, Mechanical, Civil)
PG: MS/Ph. D. Beginners in Physical Science

objective:
• To simulate and analyze key experiments in solid state physics, including semiconductor behavior, and charge carrier dynamics, thereby reinforcing theoretical concepts through interactive practice.
  • To enable learners to understand the fundamental properties of materials—such as resistivity, crystal symmetry, and temperature-dependent resistance—using techniques like the Hall effect, Cornu’s method, and four-probe measurements.
  • To provide a flexible, accessible, and repeatable virtual environment for conducting physics experiments, thereby supporting self-paced learning, concept reinforcement, and preparation for real-world laboratory work.
